summary: This bill, the Train More Primary Care Doctors Act of 2025, aims to amend the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize funding for primary care training and enhancement programs. Specifically, it proposes modifying Section 747(c)(1) to increase funding from $48,924,000 to $49,924,000 for each fiscal year between 2025 and 2030. The bill was introduced in the House of Representatives on February 4, 2025, by Mr. Nunn of Iowa and Mr. Cleaver and referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce.
